page.title: 19TRANSPORT - ROADS
page.content: {BY-PASS:}A by-pass has been planned since the 1930s but without a positive result. There are 4 routes under consideration, starting from the dual carriageway at Butser. 3 routes run west of the railway line and curve around the northern limits of Petersfield, through an area designated as outstanding natural beauty. The fourth turns east following the low land to the south of Petersfield. {MINOR ROADS:}Farms and villages are connected by minor roads which are single lane and often sunken well below field level. Farm vehicles especially combine harvesters can cause serious hold-ups on such roads. {BUS SERVICE:}Frequent buses from Petersfield to Portsmouth travel along the A3, and the occasional bus calls at Buriton.
